III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Emergency restraint
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history,
including any history of trauma, and must be done in a
manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff (unidentified) had to break up a fight and Youth A was taken
to urgent care where it was reported that "staff" hurt his neck
trying to get him off the other child. Youth A had scratches and
abrasions on his neck.
Investigation
On 3/12/24 and 4/15/24, I left a voicemail for Complainant 1.
Returned communication has not been received.
On 3/12/24, I spoke to DHHS Worker 1. Allegations and
scheduling were discussed.
On 3/12/24, I left a voicemail for FC Worker 1. I have not received
a phone call back.
Interviews:
The incident in question occurred on 3/5/24 at 4:21pm by the staff
desk area in the unit.
On 3/12/24 I spoke to Administrator 1. Allegations were
discussed. No other information was provided.
The following interviews were conducted with DHHS Worker 1 on
4/3/24 at the facility:
Youth A:
Youth A reported he believed Youth B stole clothes from him, so
he confronted Youth B. Youth B then ran towards Youth A to hit
him. They were able to hit each other. Youth A reported Staff 1
intervened and pulled Youth A away from the incident and Staff 2
2

grabbed Youth B and walked him outside. Youth A reported Staff
1 grabbed his neck, but not on purpose. Youth A reported it was a
quick movement and he didn’t feel as if Staff 1 was trying to choke
him.
Youth B:
Youth B reported he was fighting with Youth A when Staff 1 and
Staff 2 separated them. Youth B reported he grabbed Youth A’s
neck and then was pulled away from Youth A by Staff 1. Youth B
reported Staff 1 grabbed him and moved him outside. Youth B
reported Staff 2 grabbed Youth A and pulled him away. Youth B
reported this was the end of the incident.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported he was working in the unit when Youth A and
Youth B began to argue over clothes. Staff 1 reported he
attempted to verbally deescalate Youth A. Youth A and Youth B
then attempted to physically fight one another. Staff 1 reported he
took Youth A by the arms and attempted to move him away from
Youth A. Staff 2 grabbed Youth B by the arms to separate him
from Youth A as well. Staff 1 reported both youths continued to
physically fight through the staff even as the staff held them both
back from each other. Staff 1 reported Youth B was able to grab at
Youth A’s neck and scratch him before they were able to get them
into separate spaces. Staff 1 reported he felt Staff 2 was
appropriate in his handling of the youth and did not feel that he
was excessive. Staff 1 reported he did not see Staff 2 choke either
youth nor did he. Youth B went outside to calm down and Youth A
was deescalated in the building.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported he was working in the unit with Youth A and Youth
B when the two began to fight over clothes. Staff 2 reported Staff
1 was deescalating Youth A and he was attempting to deescalate
Youth B. Both youth physically went after each other and was
separated by both Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 2 reported he was able
to get Youth B away from the situation and calm him down. Staff 1
removed Youth A from the area and talked him down. Staff 2
reported while he and Staff 1 were between the youth holding
them back, the two youth were trying to hit each other and fight
through the staff. Staff 2 reported he did not see Staff 1 do
anything inappropriate or excessive. Staff 2 reported he did not
see Staff 1 choke either youth.
3

Video Review:
I reviewed video footage from 4:19:33pm-4:20:23pm. The incident
occurred on 3/5/24 in the front of the staff desk in the unit. Youth A
and Youth B are seen running at each other to fight and both Staff
1 and Staff 2 get involved. Staff 1 grabbed Youth B by the arms
and held him back and Staff 2 grabbed Youth A. Both staff are
seen attempting a Crisis Plan Intervention, the body lever. Both
youths are seen attempting to break through the staff to physically
assault one another. Youth B is seen grabbing Youth A’s neck and
letting go quickly. At 4:20:23pm, Staff 1 and Youth A left the area,
and the youth were no longer together.
Documents:
• I reviewed the CPI manual, specifically the body lever
position. Which is consistent with what was observed to
occur.
• I reviewed Staff 1 and Staff 2’s personnel file. All training
and clearances were up to date. There were no disciplinary
action provided for ether staff.
• I reviewed the Incident Report dated 3/5/24. The incident
report is consistent with the interviews and video
observation.
• I reviewed the Youth Body Chart. Scratches were noted on
Youth A’s neck area and upper right shoulder. No other
injuries were noted for either youth.
• I reviewed the urgent Care documents dated 3/5/24.
Diagnosis was acute head or neck trauma. The complaint
is mild, denies facial weakness, pain or headache. Patient
instructions were to watch for worsening symptoms.
Analysis Based on interviews and video observation, there is no evidence
to validate staff intentionally hurt either youth’s neck. Youth B
reported he grabbed Youth A’s neck and video confirmed this.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
